cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwave in progress.  So far, 6 heatwaves have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 16.6mm per hour during the storm today (ranking 2nd from our records) and resulted in 5.69mm of total rain in 3.2 hours.  The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

storm.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.
There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 10 days and counting started on 26 August 2025 and ranks 4th in length since records started in August 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (190°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 64.69 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.9°C) and outside temperature (down 2.4°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.0 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 7 mbar) and rainfall (up 1.0 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.3 mm), cloud levels (up 1371 m), and light levels (up 3634 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 106.8m higher than yesterday, 263.4m lower than the past week, 1371.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 565m minimum and 1838m maximum, with an average of 1217.3m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1480.7m and 2590m.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and winds will be practically absent. Periods of rain anticipated, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and strong and powerful sunlight. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
